question.text: Among the given options find out a group of correct features about floral characters of the family Liliaceae.

options.text: Tetrametous actinomorphic, polyphyllous unilocular ovary, axile placentation
Trimerous, actinormorphic, polyandrous superior ovay axile placentation
Six tapals, zygomorphic, six stamens, bilocular ovary, axile placentation
Bisexual, zygomorphic, gamophyllous inferior ovary marginal placentation

solution.text: Angiosperms plants are divided into two categories as monocots and dicots. Monocots have trimerous flowers while dicots have tetramerous or pentamerous flowers. Flowers of this family are actinomorphic (radial symmetry), polyandrous (several stamens), superior ovary (hypogynous), and with axile placentation (ovules in the multilocular ovary), etc.
